title: increased privileges on staff account

profile.name: Shopify
profile.about: Shopify is a multi-channel commerce platform that helps people sell online, in-store, and everywhere in between.

vulnerability_information:
staff on partners without a store management permit can have access to the collaboration shop

## steps for reproduction
1. Invite staff to partners without store management permission
2. accept the invitation and the staff has become a member of the partner
3. On the staff account, try to access the collaboration store that has been active with partners
4. staff can enter and have permissions according to those owned by the partner account

## Impact

gives staff unauthorized access to see anything in the collaboration shop

activities.message:
other impacts if the collaboration account has full permission, then staff can also do things like;
1. Open the all apps that have been installed on the collaboration shop
2. manage the shop in full (ext: add staff or delete staff and anything)

and staff only have limited permission from partners

Hi @jaka_tingkir,

I am not able to access the "Stores" section or managed stores without the "Manage Stores" permission. Could you provide more detailed reproduction steps?

1. Invite staff and give store management permission
2. invitations accepted and joined
3. enter the store with partners through a staff account
4. Revoke store management permissions on the staff account

@jack_mccracken if you are still having trouble, let me know

and my reference: #273099

Hi @jaka_tingkir,

Thank you for the additional context. I attempted your reproduction steps in an incognito browser, giving a user manage shops, signing in, and then removing the permission. Following these steps, I was logged out from the store as soon as the permission was removed.

In your video, it appears you log into a separate, non-collaborator account under the email of your less-privileged user. This is outside the collaborator account system and partners dashboard permissions have no bearing on it. For this reason, we will close this report as Not Applicable.

@jack_mccracken It looks like you saw the wrong video,

this is a new video and everything is clear.

Do I need to make a new report or do you review my report?

in video ███████ I use a new shopify account

on my side, my browser is now experiencing errors to do the translation, so what I write is always incompatible.

I hope you @jack_mccracken 
do a review of my report, because I've lost a lot of points and time to make a test of your program's security.

regards

Hi @jaka_tingkir,

We took a look at your video but it is quite hard to tell which users are performing which actions and specifically what sessions are present in each browser. It would be best if you could perform the actions in separate, freshly created incognito windows (one for each role: partners account owner, shop account owner, and low privilege partners user) so we can better understand what you're reporting.

see ███

i try from 2 browser different (chrome and firefox)

Hi @jaka_tingkir,

Thanks for the additional context. After carefully reviewing your second video, we discovered that an issue does exist where an organization member can directly log into shops with which their organization has a collaborator relationship without the Manage Shops permission. This issue has been addressed with a temporary fix. For this reason, we will triage this report and resolve it when a more permanent fix is in place.

Thanks again for your report. We're awarding a $1,500 bounty under the "Circumvention of user permission model" category for non-Core applications. This falls near the middle of the range for this vulnerability type because logging into managed stores is a relatively sensitive operation.

We'll be in touch again once the issue is resolved.

Hi @jaka_tingkir,

You are correct, this bounty was awarded under the "Core" category, not the "Non-core" category. Sorry for the confusion. As mentioned in the message above, we awarded $1500 which is in the middle of the core "Circumvention of user permission model" category (`$500 - $4,000`).
